How many single-domain antibodies were d: Six single-domain antibodies targeting the SARS-CoV-2 spike protein RBD
Four single-domain antibodies targeting the influenza virus
Eight single-domain antibodies targeting the HIV envelope protein
Five single-domain antibodies targeting the Ebola virus glycoprotein
What is one advantage of the fragment-ba: It allows for rapid generation of lead antibodies targeting preselected epitopes.
It requires high-resolution antigen structures for accurate design.
It is heavily reliant on the quality of the input structural model.
It necessitates in vitro affinity maturation for effective binding.
What potential therapeutic application i: They could be developed into neutralizing agents against SARS-CoV-2.
They could be used as diagnostic tools for detecting SARS-CoV-2.
They could serve as vaccine adjuvants to enhance immune response.
They could be applied in gene therapy to deliver antiviral genes.
What structural model was used for the i: A cryo-EM model of the spike protein
